architectural_notes: Backend currently mixes two identity systems (phrase-hash userId linkage vs principal-based calls); membership join/leave must use a consistent identity source across flows.
known_issues: Joining a pond can fail with error: "failed to join pond: user id not found" due to mismatch between phrase-hash userId expectations and principal-based join flow.

existing_features.title: Update frontend join/leave pond flows (React Query hooks and any UI components that surface join errors) so that after the backend fix, joining/leaving works without showing the previous 'user id not found' failure, and the UI refreshes membership-dependent queries correctly.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix join/leave pond membership failing due to identity mismatch (phrase-hash userId vs principal), resulting in 'user id not found' error

Update backend pond membership storage and logic so joining/leaving a pond uses Froggy Phrase hash identity (userId: Text) end-to-end, without requiring a userId→Principal lookup (userIdLinkage) and without relying on caller Principal for membership.

Ensure backend join/leave pond operations correctly update the user profile’s joinedPonds list for the phrase-hash identity (userIdUserProfiles / getUserProfileByPhraseHash), creating a default profile if none exists for that userId, and never failing due to missing linkage records.

Implement a conditional Motoko state migration (backend/migration.mo) if required by the membership storage change, so existing deployed state upgrades safely and existing ponds remain readable after upgrade.

projectName: Fix pond join/leave failing with 'user id not found' by making membership fully phrase-hash (userId) based
